subject: Re: [junit] Re: JUnit 4.x and support for Java 1.4
msgSnippet: Surely even if java 5 is not permitted in production code there can be no harm in using it to run a unit testing tool. Indeed starting with java 5 features in
messageBody:
Surely even if java 5 is not permitted in production code there can be
no harm in using it to run a unit testing tool. Indeed starting with
java 5 features in unit tests would be a good way to practice them
without risking all on the production code.

- Neil

Marvin D. Toll wrote:
>
>
> I'd like to reinforce Mark's message. In southeastern MI - I'd concur that
> Fortune Five companies (and many smaller) are two (plus) years away from
> moving to Java 1.5 and indirections .. er . I mean annotations.
>
>
>
> _Marvin
